title: Schedule
text:
Schedule
Conference schedule (with links to abstracts/handouts/posters/slides)
Download all abstracts (zip file)

title: Registration
text: The 2023 Annual Meeting on Phonology (AMP 2023) was held online on October 20-22 (not at Johns Hopkins University as originally planned). AMP, founded in 2013, is held every Fall, and showcases high quality research in all areas of phonology.

title: Registration
text:
Invited speakers
Ellen Broselow (Stony Brook University)
Laura Gwilliams (Stanford University)
Jie Zhang (University of Kansas)

title: Registration
text:
Submission info
Call for papers (with extended deadline)
Abstract submission link: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=amp2023
Thanks to everyone who submitted abstracts and reviewed them!


Any questions about conference organization can be emailed to  amp2023jhu@gmail.com.

We will post news about AMP on Phonolist. To subscribe, send a message to  phonolist+subscribe@groups.umass.edu.When you get a confirmation e-mail, reply to it (donâ€™t use the link).

title: Call for Papers
text:
We invite abstracts for either oral presentation (20 minutes, followed by 10 minutes of discussion) or poster presentation. Abstracts must be anonymous, so please be sure to eliminate any identifying information and metadata from the document. Length is limited to a maximum of two single-spaced pages (US Letter), figures and references included. Font size should be 12-point, with margins of at least one inch (2.54cm) left on all sides. Abstracts must be submitted in .pdf format.
Submissions are limited to two per author, with at most one submission being single- or primary-authored. All submissions must be novel work, not published or accepted at a journal, nor given or scheduled at another conference.
We invite abstracts in any area that bears on the central questions of our discipline, including work based on consultant data, phonological theory, computational phonology, corpus phonology, experimental phonology, neurobiology of language, diachronic change, acquisition, sign language phonology, and the interface of phonology with neighboring disciplines.
The extended deadline for abstract submission is Friday, July 14, 2023 at 11:59 p.m. (Pacific Time).
We will leave EasyChair access on through the weekend (July 15-16) for those who need a bit of extra time to write their abstract or who want to edit one they have already submitted.
Abstraction submission link: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=amp2023

title: Registration
text:
Registration
Registration for the conference is free. If you plan to attend the conference, please complete the following short form.

Those who registered by 9am on Friday, October 20 should have already received an email with Zoom and other info. The Zoom link can be found on the Schedule page of the conference website.
